Providers¶

Providers are abstractions of the provider party of the provider, consumer, user triangle. There is no reason for you to instatniate them manualy. You only should specify them in the Config.

Some provider types accept additional keyword arguments in their constructor passed to it via the Config or the authomatic.login() keyword arguments.

Here is a table of currently available providers:

OAuth 2.0 OAuth 1.0a OpenID  
oauth2.Facebook oauth1.Twitter openid.OpenID  
oauth2.Google   openid.Yahoo  
oauth2.WindowsLive   openid.Google  
    gaeopenid.GAEOpenID  
    gaeopenid.Yahoo  
    gaeopenid.Google  

OAuth 2.0 Providers¶

Providers compatible with the OAuth 2.0 protocol.

Facebook(*args, **kwargs) Facebook OAuth 2.0 provider.
Google(*args, **kwargs) Google OAuth 2.0 provider.
WindowsLive(*args, **kwargs) Windows Live OAuth 2.0 provider.
OAuth2(*args, **kwargs) Base class for OAuth 2.0 providers.
class authomatic.providers.oauth2.OAuth2(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base class for OAuth 2.0 providers.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Accepts additional keyword argument scope.

scope = None¶

list List of strings specifying requested permissions as described in the OAuth 2.0 spec.

Providers compatible with the OAuth 1.0a protocol.

Base class for OAuth 1.0a providers.

signature_generator¶

alias of HMACSHA1Generator

request_token_url[source]¶

str URL where we can get the OAuth 1.0a request token. see http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#auth_step1.

class authomatic.providers.oauth1.Twitter(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Twitter OAuth 1.0a provider.

OpenID Providers¶

Providers compatible with the OpenID protocol based on the python-openid library.

Warning

These providers are more expensive than the gaeopenid providers. The login procedure requires one more fetch and up to 8 DB accesses!

OpenID(*args, **kwargs) OpenID provider based on the python-openid library.
Yahoo(*args, **kwargs) Yahoo OpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "me.yahoo.com".
Google(*args, **kwargs) Google OpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id".
class authomatic.providers.openid.OpenID(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

OpenID provider based on the python-openid library.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Accepts optional keyword arguments: identifier, use_realm, realm_body, realm_param, xrds_param, sreg, sreg_required, ax, ax_required, pape.

use_realm = None¶

Whether to use OpenID realm. If True the realm HTML document will be accessible at {current url}?{realm_param}={realm_param} e.g. http://example.com/path?realm=realm.

realm_body = None¶

The contents of the HTML body tag of the realm.

realm_param = None¶

The name of the query parameter to be used to serve the realm.

xrds_param = None¶

The name of the query parameter to be used to serve the XRDS document.

sreg = None¶

list of optional SREG fields.

sreg_required = None¶

list of required SREG fields.

ax = None¶

list of optional AX schemas.

ax_required = None¶

list of required AX schemas.

pape = None¶

list of requested PAPE policies.

class authomatic.providers.openid.Yahoo(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Yahoo OpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "me.yahoo.com".

class authomatic.providers.openid.Google(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Google OpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id".

Google App Engine OpenID Providers¶

Providers compatible with the OpenID protocol based on the Google App Engine Users API.

Note

When using these providers the user object will always have only the user_id, email, gae_user attributes populated with data. Moreover the user_id will always be empty on the Development Server.

GAEOpenID(*args, **kwargs) OpenID provider based on the Google App Engine Users API.
Yahoo(*args, **kwargs) GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "me.yahoo.com".
Google(*args, **kwargs) GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id".
class authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.GAEOpenID(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

OpenID provider based on the Google App Engine Users API.

__init__(*args, identifier='')¶

Accepts additional keyword argument identifier, the OpenID claimed identity to authenticate.

class authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.Yahoo(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "me.yahoo.com".

class authomatic.providers.gaeopenid.Google(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

GAEOpenID provider with the identifier predefined to "https://www.google.com/accounts/o8/id".

Base Providers¶

This module provides abstract classes for implementation of protocol specific abstract classes.

login_decorator(func) Decorator to be used by the BaseProvider.login().
BaseProvider(adapter, provider_name[, ...]) Abstract base class for all providers.
AuthorisationProvider(*args, **kwargs) Base provider for authorisation protocols i.e.
AuthenticationProvider(*args, **kwargs) Base provider for authentication protocols i.e.
authomatic.providers.login_decorator(func)¶

Decorator to be used by the BaseProvider.login().

Provides mechanism for error reporting and returning result which makes the BaseProvider.login() implementation cleaner.

class authomatic.providers.BaseProvider(adapter, provider_name, callback=None, report_errors=True, logging_level=20, prefix='authomatic', **kwargs)[source]¶

Abstract base class for all providers.

adapter = None¶

The platform adapter.

name = None¶

str The provider name as specified in the Config.

callback = None¶

callable An optional callback called when the login procedure is finished with core.LoginResult passed as argument.

report_errors = None¶

bool If True exceptions which occur inside the login() will be caught and reported in the core.LoginResult.error.

logging_level = None¶

int The logging level treshold as specified in the standard Python logging library. If None or False there will be no logs. Default is logging.INFO.

prefix = None¶

str Prefix used by storing values to session.

user = None¶

core.User.

has_protected_resources[source]¶

bool Indicates whether the provider supports access to user’s protected resources.

login()[source]¶

Launches the login procedure to get user’s credentials from provider.

Should be decorated with login_decorator(). The login procedure is considered finished when the user attribute is not empty when the method runs out of it’s flow or when there are errors.

classmethod get_type()[source]¶

Returns the provider type.

Returns:str The full dotted path to base class e.g. "authomatic.providers.oauth2.OAuth2".
update_user()[source]¶

Updates and returns user.

Returns:core.User
classmethod csrf_generator()¶

Generates CSRF token.

Inspired by this article http://blog.ptsecurity.com/2012/10/random-number-security-in-python.html

Returns:str Random unguessable string.
class authomatic.providers.AuthorisationProvider(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base provider for authorisation protocols i.e. protocols which allow a consumer to be authorized by a provider to access protected resources of a user. e.g. OAuth 2.0 or OAuth 1.0a.

has_protected_resources = True¶

Indicates whether the provider supports access to user’s protected resources.

consumer = None¶

core.Consumer

short_name = None¶

Short name as specified in the Config.

user_authorisation_url[source]¶

str URL to which we redirect the user to grant our app i.e. the consumer an authorisation to access his protected resources. see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.1 and http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#auth_step2.

access_token_url[source]¶

str URL where we can get the access token to access protected resources of a user. see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.3 and http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#auth_step3.

user_info_url[source]¶

str URL where we can get the user info. see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-7 and http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#anchor12.

to_tuple(credentials)[source]¶

Must convert credentials to a tuple to be used by core.Credentials.serialize().

Warning

Must be a classmethod!

Parameters:credentials (core.Credentials) – core.Credentials
Returns:tuple
reconstruct(deserialized_tuple, cfg)[source]¶

Must convert the deserialized_tuple back to core.Credentials.

Warning

Must be a classmethod!

Parameters:
  • deserialized_tuple (tuple) – A tuple which first index is the short_name and the rest are all the items of the tuple created by to_tuple().
  • cfg (dict) – Config
fetch_protected_resource(adapter, url, credentials, content_parser, method='GET', headers={}, response_parser=None)¶

Fetches protected resource asynchronously.

Warning

Whether the method is really asynchronous depends on the implementation of the adapter’s fetch_async() method.

Parameters:
  • adapter – The same adapter instance which was used in the authomatic.login() function to get the user’s core.Credentials.
  • credentials (core.Credentials) – Credentials of the user whose protected resource we want to access.
  • url (str) – URL of the protected resource. Can contain query parameters.
  • method (str) – HTTP method of the request.
  • content_parser (callable) – A callable as described in core.Response.content_parser.
Returns:

adapters.RPC
create_request(url, method='GET', content_parser=None, response_parser=None)[source]¶

Creates an authorized request to protected resources of a user.

Parameters:
  • url (str) – URL of the protected resource. Can contain query parameters.
  • method (str) – HTTP method of the request.
  • content_parser (callable) – A callable as described in core.Response.content_parser.
  • response_parser (callable) – A callable as described in core.Request.response_parser.
Returns:

core.Request
fetch_user_info()[source]¶

Makes synchronous request to user_info_url and returns the core.UserInfoResponse.

Returns:core.UserInfoResponse
update_user()[source]¶

Updates the user.

Warning

Makes a request to user_info_url!

Returns:core.User
user_info_request[source]¶

Returns an asynchronous request to user_info_url whose get_response() method returns a core.UserInfoResponse.

Returns:core.Request
class authomatic.providers.AuthenticationProvider(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base provider for authentication protocols i.e. protocols which allow a provider to authenticate a claimed identity of a user. e.g. OpenID.

has_protected_resources = False¶

Indicates whether the provider supports access to user’s protected resources.

identifier = ''¶

str The claimed identity of a user.
